page.title: 05Thornton Heath History 2
page.content:
In Trumble Gardens there used to be some big houses but these were destroyed in The Second World War.
It is said that Dick Turpin once lived in Thornton Heath in a little cottage where Thornton Heath presently stands. The railways in Thornton Heath vastly affected the area and the population grew very large.Thornton Heath is the most densly populated in the Croydon Borough.
Many other things are changing as well;small shops are being replaced by supermarkets;big old houses are being demolished to build new flats.The whole face of Thornton Heath has changed over the years and will carry on changing.
